metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Characteristics of asymptomatic patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection in Jinan, China Characteristics of asymptomatic patients with SARS-CoV-2 infection in Jinan Characteristics of asymptomatic patients with SARS-CoV-2

abstract.text: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by severe acute 10 respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2(SARS-CoV-2) is continuously and 11 rapidly circulating at present. Asymptomatic patients have been proven to 12 be contagious and thus pose a significant infection control challenge.

Here we describe the characteristics of asymptomatic patients with 14 SARS-CoV-2 infection in Jinan, Shandong province, China. A total of 47 15 patients with confirmed COVID-19 were recruited. Among them, 11 16 patients were categorized as asymptomatic cases. We found that the 17 asymptomatic patients in Jinan were relatively young and were mainly 18 clustered cases. The laboratory indicators and lung lesion on chest CT 19 were mild. No special factors were found accounting for the presence or 20 absence of symptoms. The presence of asymptomatic patients increased 21 the difficulty of screening. It is necessary to strengthen the identification 22

body_text.text: of such patients in the future.

Keywords: SARS-CoV-2; COVID-19; asymptomatic; characteristics 24 1. The 106 detailed clinical characteristics were found in Table 2 and 3.

FIGREF0.text: 27 confirmed in other provinces of China and multiple countries around the 28 world[6-8]. As of March 10, 2020, more than 110 000 confirmed cases of 29 COVID-19 have been reported in 110 countries[9]. The most common 30 clinical manifestation of the disease is fever, fatigue, and dry cough and 31 some patients may present with nasal congestion, runny nose, and 32 diarrhea. In some cases, dyspnea usually occurs one week after the 33 disease onset and some patients can rapidly progress to septic shock, 34 acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), refractory metabolic 35 acidosis, and coagulation disorders[10, 11]. As the situation progressed 36 over time, more and more asymptomatic individuals were identified due 37 to increased surveillance and contact screening[12]. Those asymptomatic 38 cases may play a role in the transmission and thus pose a significant 39 infection control challenge. To best of our knowledge, so far, there is no 40 special paper describing the features of these patients. Here we report the 41 characteristics of asymptomatic patients with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 42 infection admitted to Jinan infectious disease hospital, Shandong 43 University. The hospital is the only one designated medical institution for 44

FIGREF1.text: Clinical characteristics of asymptomatic patients in the study 95 For 11 asymptomatic patients, 5 were mild cases and 6 were common 96 cases; the median time from admission to negative conversion of viral 97 RNA was 10 days, ranging from 3 days to 34 days; and the median time 98 of hospital stay was 14 days, ranging from 10 days to 30 days. Compared 99 with symptomatic patients, the hospital stay of asymptomatic patients is 100 significantly shorter (14 days vs 22.5days, P=0.004), while the diagnostic 101 classification and time of negative viral RNA conversion did not differ 102 between two groups. For the 36 symptomatic patients, the most common103

FIGREF2.text: Laboratory and radiologic findings of asymptomatic patients in the 108 study 109 The blood cell test results showed that 27.3% (3/11) asymptomatic patients had decreased white blood cell and 36.4% (4/11) had increased 111 lymphocyte count. Increased or decreased platelet counts were also found 112 in these patients. Levels of lactate dehydrogenase and creatine kinase-MB 113 increased in about half of the patients. Other laboratory findings in the 114 asymptomatic patients included higher or lower levels of fibrinogen, 115 higher levels of D-dimmer, C-reactive protein and ESR. Although there 116 were many laboratory abnormalities in asymptomatic patients, compared 117 with symptomatic patients, most of the indicators were not statistically 118 significant. 119 Abnormalities on chest computed tomograms (CT) were detected in 7 120 asymptomatic patients (63.6%) (Table 4)，of which 4 (36.4%) showed 121 bilateral involvement and 3 (27.3%) showed unilateral involvement. 122 Compared with symptomatic patients, asymptomatic patients had fewer 123 lung CT lesions (63.6% vs 83.3%), and there was no statistical difference 124 between the two groups. The typical chest CT findings of these patients 125 were unilateral or bilateral multiple ground-glass opacities or 126 consolidation. Fig.1 showed representative lung images of an 127 asymptomatic patient in which lesions developed in multiple lobes, most 128 of which were subpleural ground-glass opacity co-existed with 129 consolidation. Fig.2 showed dynamic changes of the chest CT of an 130 asymptomatic patient obtained on February 5(A), February 8(B), 131 February 14(C) and February 19(D).

FIGREF3.text: arbidol, and inhalation of recombinant human interferon. The 135 duration of antiviral treatment was 10-15 days. As of 24:00, March 10, 136 2020, 100%(36/36) symptomatic patients and 81.8% (9/11) asymptomatic 137 patients have been discharged, and the remained 2 patients still have 138 positive nucleic acid test results.

FIGREF4.text: coronavirus outbreak in China and other countries is the 141 third epidemic caused by coronavirus in the 21st century, already 142 surpassing SARS and MERS in the number of individuals infected[6]. 143 The COVID-19 can present a variety of manifestations ranging from no 144 symptoms or mild disease to severe pneumonia or multi-organ failure. It 145 is expected that early in the development of an outbreak, severe cases are 146 recognized first and then less severe (mild or asymptomatic) cases are 147 detected with increasing surveillance. The occurrence of asymptomatic 148 individuals increased the difficulty of screening, helped spread the 149 disease, therefore, posed a significant public health issue.150In our study, a total of 47 patients were diagnosed as COVID-19 from 151 January 23 to March 10, of which 11 (23.4%) patients had no symptom.

FIGREF5.text: The asymptomatic proportion (23.4%) is higher than the data (17.9%)153    reported by Kenji Mizumoto[13]. Among 11 asymptomatic patients, 9(81.9%) were cluster cases, 8(72.7%) of which were family cluster cases 155 and 1 (9.1%) were other cluster cases. The presence of cluster cases 156 strongly suggested the need to isolate patients and quarantine for close157    contacts, especially those family close contacts. The median age of the 158 asymptomatic patients was 23 years old, which is younger than the 159 symptomatic patients(35.5 years), while there was no statistical 160 significance between the two groups. For the 36 symptomatic patients, 161 Fever (77.8%), dry cough (47.2%), expectoration (11.1%), fatigue 162 (11.1%), sore throat (11.1%), myalgia (11.1%) were the most common163 symptoms，which was consistent with previous studies[3-5, 14]. 164 Laboratory findings of the asymptomatic patients showed that some 165 patients might have abnormalities in indicators such as blood cell count, 166 fibrinogen, D-dimmer, C-reactive protein, ESR and myocardial enzymes.167 Compared with symptomatic patients, most of the laboratory test results 168 were not statistically significant. It is worth noting that creatine 169 kinase-MB was significantly higher in the asymptomatic group than in 170 the symptomatic group(P=0.020). Future research is needed to expand the 171 sample to clarify that this indicator does indeed differ between the two 172 groups. Although some asymptomatic patients' laboratory indicators were 173 abnormal, the damage was minor and soon returned to normal. 7 174 asymptomatic patients (63.6%) were detected lung abnormalities on chest 175 CT. Compared with symptomatic patients, asymptomatic patients had 176 fewer lung CT lesions (63.6% vs 83.3%), and there was also no statistical 177 difference between the two groups. All of the laboratory test results and 178 radiologic findings showed the patients experienced relatively mild 179 illness, which was further evidenced by the short hospital stay of 180 asymptomatic patients(P=0.004). All the patients' treatment regimen were 181 produced according to the diagnostic and treatment guidelines for 182 COVID-19 issued by the National Health Commission of the People's 183 Republic of China. As of 24:00, March 10, 2020, 100%(36/36) 184 symptomatic patients and 81.8% (9/11) asymptomatic patients have been 185 discharged. 2 asymptomatic patients still hospitalized for nucleic acid 186 positive. 187 Asymptomatic patients have been proven to be contagious and thus 188 pose a significant infection control challenge[15-17]. Initially, we hoped 189 to find whether there existed factors accounting for the presence or 190 absence of symptoms which could help us to screen the asymptomatic 191 individuals, and further help to control the disease. In our study, we 192 compared the characteristics of asymptomatic and symptomatic cases and 193 have not found effective indicators to meet our requirements. Therefore, 194 the symptomatic patients should be given timely isolation and treatment, 195 and relevant contacts should be tracked and quarantined as soon as 196 possible. The timely diagnosis, isolation and treatment of these 197 asymptomatic patients will help control the further spread of SARS-CoV-2. Future studies should investigate viral loads and viral 199 dynamics of asymptomatic patients, and examine whether they are 200 different from symptomatic patients. Such researches will enhance the 201 understanding of the pathogenesis of the new emerging virus and would 202 help to control the disease early. 203 Our study has some limitations. First, our research samples are 204 relatively small and it was difficult to get a full picture of the spectrum of 205 the disease. Second, our asymptomatic patients may truly have no 206 symptoms, or they may not feel it because the symptoms are not obvious. 207 Third, some indicators related to patient's viral loads or immunity, such 208 as CD4 + and CD8 + cells, are not involved in this study. All of those can 209 lead to a biased understanding of the disease.210 In conclusion, our study showed the clinical characteristics of 211 asymptomatic patients with COVID-19 in Jinan, China. The patients were 212 relatively young and were mainly clustered cases. The laboratory 213 indicators and lung lesion on chest CT were mild. No special factors were 214 found accounting for the presence or absence of symptoms. The presence 215 of asymptomatic patients increased the difficulty of screening. It is 216 necessary to strengthen the identification of such patients in the future.

TABREF0.text: the hospitalization of confirmed patients with COVID-19 in Jinan, capital of Shandong province, China. Furthermore, we compared the features between asymptomatic and symptomatic cases to determine whether there exist factors accounting for the presence or absence of symptoms. All the inpatients with COVID-19 confirmed by pharyngeal swab COVID-19 nucleic acid test from January 23 to March 10 in Jinan infectious disease hospital, Shandong University were included in this 53 study. The patients were diagnosed and treated according to the 54 "Diagnosis and Treatment Guideline for COVID-19" distributed by Chinese National Health Commission[10].The medical records of patients were analyzed by the research team.
